snippet.textDisplay:
The G305 has easily become my favorite mouse, but there is one major issue with it and that's the scroll wheel. Mine isn't accurate and can get stuck between steps and suddenly free itself. This is especially annoying in games where the scroll wheel is bound to jumping, such as Apex Legends and CS:GO. Other than that it's by far the best mouse in the line-up for claw/hybrid grippers. I've had the G603 and G502 and the G603 is just too big and heavy and the G502 is just too heavy.


Edit: After watching this video completely I have to say that Linus' take on gaming mice isn't what you should be listening to. For example, the G305 side buttons are really mushy compared to other mice, and a high arch like the one from the Razer Basilisk won't be comfortable for every grip type, especially not claw or hybrid grippers. If you want to see proper mouse reviews go check out Rocketjumpninja's channel.
snippet.textOriginal:
The G305 has easily become my favorite mouse, but there is one major issue with it and that's the scroll wheel. Mine isn't accurate and can get stuck between steps and suddenly free itself. This is especially annoying in games where the scroll wheel is bound to jumping, such as Apex Legends and CS:GO. Other than that it's by far the best mouse in the line-up for claw/hybrid grippers. I've had the G603 and G502 and the G603 is just too big and heavy and the G502 is just too heavy.


Edit: After watching this video completely I have to say that Linus' take on gaming mice isn't what you should be listening to. For example, the G305 side buttons are really mushy compared to other mice, and a high arch like the one from the Razer Basilisk won't be comfortable for every grip type, especially not claw or hybrid grippers. If you want to see proper mouse reviews go check out Rocketjumpninja's channel.

snippet.textDisplay: In my experience, Omron switches are suffering the same degree of overrating as CherryMX keyboard switches. Flamboyant keystroke ratings that become irrelevant far too soon because the stupid things will just start doubleclicking way before even coming close to those marketing ratings despite regular cleaning. Fortunately Logitech's no nonsense warranty kinda makes up for the ATROCIOUSLY BAD quality of these ridiculously overrated switches. I've already RMA'd my G703 twice before warranty expires. It sucks, because the sensor is great, and the mouse itself is super comfortable. Honest question: Is this video sponsored by Logitech?
snippet.textOriginal: In my experience, Omron switches are suffering the same degree of overrating as CherryMX keyboard switches. Flamboyant keystroke ratings that become irrelevant far too soon because the stupid things will just start doubleclicking way before even coming close to those marketing ratings despite regular cleaning. Fortunately Logitech's no nonsense warranty kinda makes up for the ATROCIOUSLY BAD quality of these ridiculously overrated switches. I've already RMA'd my G703 twice before warranty expires. It sucks, because the sensor is great, and the mouse itself is super comfortable. Honest question: Is this video sponsored by Logitech?

snippet.textDisplay:
my G403 has this strange issue where, when I turn the mousewheel, the results on screen go either direction randomly can be up or down, up AND down... in short, the mousewheels behavior is totally random. so, I had to replace it, sadly, because otherwise it would be the perfect mouse for almost everything.
if someone experienced this strange behaviour and worked out a solution, PLEASE let me know!

snippet.textDisplay: Thanks for including the comments on hand sizes.  As someone with large hands I find shopping for a new mouse to be one of those things that is difficult.  Most shops only stock smaller mice or ones made for work rather than gaming.  While I comfortably use a Logitech G700s (having said that it is still too small for me to palm grip) it is getting old and is rather heavy.  Also the battery life sucks enough that these days I have a power cable permanently attached.  I would like to replace it with a lighter mouse but without reviews like or being able to try them out this it is difficult to find a model to suite.
snippet.textOriginal: Thanks for including the comments on hand sizes.  As someone with large hands I find shopping for a new mouse to be one of those things that is difficult.  Most shops only stock smaller mice or ones made for work rather than gaming.  While I comfortably use a Logitech G700s (having said that it is still too small for me to palm grip) it is getting old and is rather heavy.  Also the battery life sucks enough that these days I have a power cable permanently attached.  I would like to replace it with a lighter mouse but without reviews like or being able to try them out this it is difficult to find a model to suite.

snippet.textDisplay: G600 is best mouse. Went out and got a backup G600 if the one I'm using ever dies. My only complaint is that there is no cover over the sensor on the bottom so a small stray hair can get lodged inside and REALLY screws with accuracy, needing to be picked out with tweezers or the like. Works great for every type of game I play, FPS included. But that latter sensor problem can be induce REAL RAGE in FPS if it hits you.
snippet.textOriginal: G600 is best mouse. Went out and got a backup G600 if the one I'm using ever dies. My only complaint is that there is no cover over the sensor on the bottom so a small stray hair can get lodged inside and REALLY screws with accuracy, needing to be picked out with tweezers or the like. Works great for every type of game I play, FPS included. But that latter sensor problem can be induce REAL RAGE in FPS if it hits you.

snippet.textDisplay: Just buy a Logitech g502 SE.
snippet.textOriginal: Just buy a Logitech g502 SE.

snippet.textDisplay: I am a huge fan of Logitech. After spending way too much money on inexpensive mice and keyboards, I broke down and spent some money on a k360 keyboard and M510 cordless mouse. I absolutely love the mouse. The keyboard was okay for general use, but had no place in gaming.  So when I found a reconditioned Wave K350 on Ebay, I snagged it. Once you go Logitech, it is damn near impossible to use anything else. You know you have found a quality piece of hardware, is when it can survive, Gamer Rage.
snippet.textOriginal: I am a huge fan of Logitech. After spending way too much money on inexpensive mice and keyboards, I broke down and spent some money on a k360 keyboard and M510 cordless mouse. I absolutely love the mouse. The keyboard was okay for general use, but had no place in gaming.  So when I found a reconditioned Wave K350 on Ebay, I snagged it. Once you go Logitech, it is damn near impossible to use anything else. You know you have found a quality piece of hardware, is when it can survive, Gamer Rage.
